column1: ... = data not available; | = marks break in series; – = magnitude equals zero; 0 or 0.0 = magnitude is less than half of unit employed; * = provisional, preliminary, estimate, budget figure; $ = United States dollars; cif = cost, insurance, and freight; fob = free on board; GDP = gross domestic product; GNI = gross national income; IMF = International Monetary Fund; km2 = square kilometer; kWh = kilowatt-hour; m3 = cubic meter; NPISHs = nonprofit institutions serving households; SDRs = special drawing rights; t = metric ton; TJS = somoni.

column2: Refers to the annual averages of monthly data.
Figures are as of end of year.

Includes real estate activities; professional, scientific, and technical activities; administrative and support service activities; arts, entertainment, and recreation; activities of households as employers; and undifferentiated goods- and services-producing activities of households for own use.
For 2008 onward, data are adjusted according to new classification of data.
Refers to foreign currency deposits. For 2008 onward, refers to other deposits in foreign currency.
Calculated as the sum of M1 and time deposits.
Calculated as the sum of M2 and quasi-money.
Consists of claims on nonfinancial public sector.
Includes claims from nonfinancial and other financial institutions.
Consists of claims on net credit to other depository corporations.
For 2000 onward, data are adjusted to be consistent with M2.
When data on grants and net lending are not available, figures are equal to total revenue minus total expenditure.
Refers to credit from banks, repayments, gross proceeds from privatization, and other domestic nonbank financing.
Expenditure on defense is included in social protection.
Refers to expenditures of the national economy.

Prior to 2005, data follow the IMF's Balance of Payments Manual (fifth edition). For 2005 onward, data follow the IMF's Balance of Payments and International Investment Position Manual (sixth edition) .
